info.title: Password Security
info.description: This quiz tests your knowledge on best practices for creating strong passwords, password managers, and Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA).

questions.question: Which of the following is the best practice for creating a strong password?
options: Using a combination of letters, numbers, and symbols
Using only lowercase letters and numbers
Using your name and date of birth
Reusing the same password for multiple accounts
questions.answer: Using a combination of letters, numbers, and symbols

questions.question: What is the primary benefit of using a password manager?
options: It generates and stores strong, unique passwords for each account
It allows you to share your passwords securely with coworkers
It eliminates the need for two-factor authentication
It remembers only one password for all accounts
questions.answer: It generates and stores strong, unique passwords for each account

questions.question: How often should you change your passwords?
options: Only when you suspect a security breach
Every week
Only if the password is too long
At least once every few months, or if a breach occurs
questions.answer: At least once every few months, or if a breach occurs

questions.question: Which of the following passwords is the weakest?
options: P@ssword123!
Qwerty123
G!8z$3xK@7mQ
A randomly generated 16-character password

questions.question: Why should you avoid using personal information in passwords?
options: Because it makes passwords harder to remember
Because attackers can easily guess them using social engineering
Because passwords should only contain numbers
Because it makes logging in more difficult
questions.answer: Because attackers can easily guess them using social engineering

questions.question: What is Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA)?
options: A security feature that requires more than one form of authentication to access an account
A feature that allows users to log in without a password
A system that stores all passwords in an encrypted file
A security question that users answer after entering their password
questions.answer: A security feature that requires more than one form of authentication to access an account

questions.question: Which of the following is the safest way to store your passwords?
options: Writing them down in a notebook
Saving them in a password-protected Excel file
Memorizing all passwords
Using a trusted password manager

questions.question: What is the recommended minimum length for a secure password?
options: At least 6 characters
At least 8 characters
At least 12 characters
At least 4 characters

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT an effective way to secure your passwords?
options: Enabling Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA)
Using the same password for every account to avoid forgetting it
Using a password manager to store unique passwords
Changing passwords after a data breach
questions.answer: Using the same password for every account to avoid forgetting it

questions.question: What should you do if you suspect your password has been compromised?
options: Ignore it and continue using the same password
Change the password immediately and enable Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA)
Wait until you receive a notification from your company
Log in once to confirm if the password still works before taking any action
questions.answer: Change the password immediately and enable Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA)
